meanings.definition: A cone-shaped fruiting body of certain plants, such as hops or alder.
meanings.sent1: The strobiles on the tree looked like tiny pine cones.
meanings.sent2: She collected strobiles from the forest to study their structure.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel mistook the strobiles for acorns and tried to bury them.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas sprouted like strobiles, growing into full-fledged plans.
meanings.sent5: The strobiles swayed gently in the breeze, releasing their seeds.

meanings.definition: A cluster of scales or bracts, such as those found on a pine cone.
meanings.sent1: The strobiles on the pine cone were tightly packed together.
meanings.sent2: The hiker admired the intricate patterns on the strobiles of the pine cone.
meanings.sent3: The artist used strobiles from different cones to create a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts clustered like strobiles, forming a dense web of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The strobiles on the pine cone glistened in the sunlight, reflecting their beauty.

meanings.definition: A type of inflorescence in which the flowers are densely packed on a central axis.
meanings.sent1: The strobiles of the flower cluster created a stunning display.
meanings.sent2: Bees buzzed around the strobiles, collecting nectar from each flower.
meanings.sent3: The garden looked like a party with all the strobiles dancing in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room, spreading like strobiles in bloom.
meanings.sent5: The strobiles of the inflorescence stood tall, attracting pollinators with their vibrant colors.
